emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Code Synthesis
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems capable of not only assisting but also autonomously creating complex software, testing, and deploying it.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: This technology could drastically reduce the time to market for software, potentially leading to job displacement in coding roles but also creating new roles in AI management and ethics.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires significant improvements in AI ethics, trust in AI systems, and regulatory frameworks for AI-driven development.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: Blockchain technologies that are secure against quantum computing attacks, ensuring long-term data integrity.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances trust in digital transactions and data storage, crucial for the security of future digital economies.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption depends on the advancement of quantum computing and the urgency to protect existing blockchain systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Wearables for Cognitive Enhancement
emerging_technologies.description: Devices that can enhance cognitive functions through non-invasive brain stimulation, aiding learning, memory, and mental health.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could widen the gap between those with access to such technology and those without, raising ethical concerns about cognitive enhancement.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires breakthroughs in neuroscience, user safety protocols, and public acceptance of brain-computer interfaces.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Air Mobility
emerging_technologies.description: Fully autonomous drones and air taxis for urban transport, reducing congestion and improving mobility.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential to revolutionize city planning and daily commutes but brings challenges in regulation, safety, and noise pollution.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Infrastructure development, regulatory approval, and public trust in autonomous flying vehicles.

emerging_technologies.name: AI Collaborative Programming Environments
emerging_technologies.description: Platforms where AI not only assists but actively collaborates with human developers in real-time, enhancing productivity and creativity.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Changes the nature of work in software development, possibly reducing the need for large development teams while increasing efficiency.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Acceptance by developers, integration with existing tools, and addressing privacy concerns in collaborative environments.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Powered Code Review
mainstream_technologies.description: AI tools that automatically review code for security vulnerabilities, coding standards, and efficiency, becoming a standard in development practices.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in large enterprises and tech companies, with open-source communities also leveraging these tools.

mainstream_technologies.name: Smart Energy Grids
mainstream_technologies.description: Advanced energy grids that optimize distribution, integrate renewable sources, and enhance grid stability.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Increasingly implemented in cities and regions aiming for sustainability, backed by government initiatives.

epoch_themes.description: The shift towards AI systems that operate with greater autonomy in decision-making and task execution.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Redefines work, privacy, and ethical considerations around AI autonomy and responsibility.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push for AI ethics frameworks, regulatory bodies, and public discourse on AI governance.

epoch_themes.description: The integration of technology for sustainable urban development, focusing on reducing carbon footprints and improving quality of life.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes cleaner, more efficient cities but could lead to social inequalities if not managed inclusively.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Urban planning initiatives, green technology investments, and international agreements on climate action.
